pros: It is small enough to surpass plenty of bureaucratic barriers to do many things and also big enough to have many resources. Academic freedom is great.
cons: Salary is lower than many other colleges in the region.
Very gig like get assigned students that sometimes will use your services

job_title: OIT Service Desk Agent in Rochester, NY
cons: No flexible time off from shifts

pros: It's great working with the students
cons: The administration gives little respect to the adjuncts. Poor communications, no warning when contracts won't be renewed. No union.

pros: Great culture, great colleagues and tuition exchange
cons: Salary is lower compared to similar positions at other schools

pros: Good people nice benefit package. Interactive work
cons: Compensation does not reflect current workforce

pros: Wonderful atmosphere and supportive colleagues. Great benefits.
cons: Wages are low, but benefits help make up for it.

job_title: Career and Academic Advisor in Rochester, NY
pros: Great Benefits, Great Students, Lots of Activities to Give Back
cons: Lacks Flexibility with regard to work/life balance

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Rochester, NY
pros: Good flexibility with hours and not a hard position to get used to.
cons: It was just a student work-study so not many cons.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Rochester, NY
pros: Great students and department. Tight knit community.
cons: None come to mind right away.

review_title: Very Positive Tutoring Experience as a Student
pros: Flexible hours, enjoyable work, good students to work for. As a student doing tutoring this worked out very well. That being said I only worked a few hours a week.
cons: Wage was very low but I was an undergraduate doing tutoring so it is understandable. Other than that I really had no complaints.

pros: Latitude in what can be delivered in the classroom, great students, great atmosphere. Department tries to keep everyone engaged.
cons: Being an adjunct does not lend itself to relationship-building within the department. Teaching at night or at varied times from full time faculty does not allow for one to attend meetings and be a part of the fabric of the institution, similar to other institutions, for sure.

pros: Convenient location on bus line. Commuter school. Students all the same. Faculty mostly the same. Starts term after Labor Day.
cons: Everybody has the same lily white face. Ok to work there if you like to drink wine with the Dean.

review_title: I love working here, besides the best students ever, love the folks I work with.
pros: I get to learn from the students, It's close to my house, love the people I work with, and it snows!!!
cons: It only snows five months of the year!!

pros: Very friendly and helpful.  Make lots of connections with SJFC community.  Very flexible with schedule and convenient location.  Friendly staff and many resources to go to. Open to all majors.
cons: I don't have any cons at the moment

review_title: Precepted an FNP student 2016.  Taught in the FNP program 2000-2002
job_title: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner in New York, NY
pros: It has a great nursing and FNP program.  The students graduate prepared for the workplace
cons: Only have an FNP graduated program

pros: Laid back environment, staff is easy to get along with, expectations are very clear.
cons: The students and parents themselves are frustrating, and the tour can get be kind of repetitive
